page.title: 09Arthur's History of Esholt
page.content: {Arthur is about 65 years old.He moved {to Esholt about 20 years ogo from {Wilsden.He now lives in a cottage on {the main street. The main street was owned in 1066 by a family called Thompson.Later it was owned by the Cromptons,then the Calverleys,and finally the Stansfield family.The last of the Stansfields died last year.there were two halls and a convent which were won in a battle. Esholt church was built by the Stansfields-and it was used as their family church.The Old Hall was built in 1600.Bradford Corporation fought the Stansfields for the land. The Stansfields won twice. However,the Corporation finally won and the land was made into a sewage works. {Esholt people are very proud of their {village,and most people,when we {interviewed them told us about history
